title: Tom Petty - TV 1994-1996
description:
Here is a nice bootleg. Check my account for more classic bootlegs.

Please enjoy, share with friends and please seed :)


Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers
TV Various Performances
Sept 1994 - Sept 1996

w/Menues & Chapters

The Stonecutter Collection vol 101

Source: VHS masters

Transfer: (VCR) Aiwa FX 8000 > (DVD SA) Magnavox MDR 557H

NTSC DVD5 burned at high quality 60 min mode.

DVD Decrypter > VOB > Flac

Transferred by: Rich B. / kingrue upload 697

Authoring: TMPGEnc Authoring Works


A) MTV Music Awards, Radio City Music Hall, NYC Sept 8, 1994
Accepts Award 1) Mary Jane's Last Dance

B) David Letterman, New York Sept 9, 1994
1) You Don't Know How It Feels (1st live performance)

C) MTV Week In Rock Nov 18, 1994
1) Interview by Tabitha Soren

D) Saturday Night Live, NYC (w/Dave Grohl) Nov 19, 1994
1) You Don't Know How It Feels
2) Honey Bee

E) David Letterman, New York Nov 21, 1994
1) You Wreck Me + Interview

F) Jay Leno Tonight Show, Los Angeles Aug 5, 1996
1) Walls Fall Down + Interview

G) Saturday Night Live, NYC Sept 28, 1996
1) Walls Fall Down
2) Angel Dream #4

H) David Letterman, New York Sept 30, 1996
1) Walls Fall Down + Interview


Stonecutter:
"Well,I see another in our video series has gone up. Think everyone who likes Tom will def like this. They are all Ex quality and there are some great performances here as well. I esp love the MTV and Letterman that kick it off,that version of Mary Jane scalds.
This is an interesting time for the band as well,as you see the Heartbreakers lose their drummer Stan Lynch ,have Dave Grohl for one night and then pick up the permanent replacement Steve Ferrone.
I've made a bunch of these for lots of different bands. We'll see what we can get too.
If anybody is interested in putting proper menus and chapters to this DVD,please feel free to do so,I'd love to see that posted.
As always huge Thanks to George for doing posting.
Enjoy Everybody
Rich B. "


Thanks to Stonecutter and Kingrue
